newsitem.title: UK: NetNames report details Internet name registration.
newsitem.headline: NetNames report details Internet name registration.

text.p: NetNames, an Internet name registry based in London and New York, on Wednesday said it is releasing the first Global Domain Name Report, providing comprehensive information on registering Internet domain names all around the world.
The report covers what domain companies should register under, limitations on registration, trademark issues, fees to be paid, and whether companies can make multiple registrations.

The report covers about 200 countries and offers information ranging from the technical to the amusingly useful. "In Singapore you need to be 'in good standing with the registry of companies' to get a registration, while Mauritius demands 'no offensive names or names in bad taste' ", NetNames said.
